extensionDescription.message: A good drag and drop extension that improve your browsing experience

helpActionCommand.message: the command of action. "Open" will open a tab and use selected content as url; "Copy" writes the selected content into clipboard; "Search Request" will open a tab with url base on this request template; "Download" let browser download selected content; "Script" inject script into web page

helpActionPrompt.message: the text to show up when action will be performed. if this field left blank, the name of action will show up

helpActionOperationMode.message: the operation mode of this action. "direction chain" allows multiple direction to pick actions. "normal" allows one direction to pick actions. "circle menu" shows a menu which you can pick actionsã€‚"context menu" will register a context menu item associating this action

helpActionDirection.message: use one direction to match this action

helpActionDirectionChain.message: use multiple directions to match this action

helpActionPreferDataType.message: decide which data you prefer to processed when performing action.

helpCommandRequest.message: open a new tab with the url that is based on request template

helpActionIcon.message: the icon of action that showed under menu operation mode

helpActionContainer.message: specific how to deal with container when open new tab. you can use "[Inherit Container]" to let new tab inherit the container of opener tab, or specific another container

helpCompatibility.message: Configure the compatibility of dragging behavior between the site and extension (Still can't work on Privileged Page). "Pattern" is a JavaScript regular expression used for match the url of site. "Enable" means the extension will normally work on that site; however, when the extension detects the site itself is managing the dragging action, the extension will stop working. "Disable" means the extension won't work at that site. "Force" is similar to "Enable", except that extension will continue working although the site manages the dragging action.

helpTabPosition.message: specific the position of new created tab. Choosing "Ignore" indicates the position is controlled by browser; "Next" places the new tab after to the current tab, when continuously opening many background tabs, the new tab will be placed at the end of those background tabs; "After" always places the new tab after the current tab
